name: Vegan Churro Biscotti - Cinnamon Sugar Biscotti
description: These Vegan Churro Biscotti with Cinnamon Sugar are perfectly crunchy for dunking in a hot cup of coffee, tea, or cocoa, or on their own. Impossible to eat just one!
recipeIngredient: 2 tbsp almond flour (, Omit to make  nut free)
1 1/2 tbsp sugar (I use a mixture of coconut sugar and brown sugar)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the flour, cornstarch, almond flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon, and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix the flour, cornstarch, almond flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon, and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, mix the non dairy milk, oil, maple syrup, and sugar. Mix well until the sugar is dissolved.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, mix the non dairy milk, oil, maple syrup, and sugar. Mix well until the sugar is dissolved.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the wet with the dry, and mix to make a sticky, stiff doughy mixture. Transfer this to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the wet with the dry, and mix to make a sticky, stiff doughy mixture. Transfer this to a parchment-lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Wet your hands and using more water, shape the mixture into an oval, and press it down to even it out so that it is about 1/2-3/4 inches thick. Keep pressing, use a couple more drops of water for whenever it gets sticky again, and keep pressing and spread it out.
recipeInstructions.name: Wet your hands and using more water, shape the mixture into an oval, and press it down to even it out so that it is about 1/2-3/4 inches thick. Keep pressing, use a couple more drops of water for whenever it gets sticky again, and keep pressing and spread it out.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, mix the sugar and cinnamon for topping until well combined, and then sprinkle this all over the dough(which should still be a bit wet on the top). Press it down lightly with your hands if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, mix the sugar and cinnamon for topping until well combined, and then sprinkle this all over the dough(which should still be a bit wet on the top). Press it down lightly with your hands if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 350 degrees F(180 C) for 22-25 minutes. Check with a toothpick in the center.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 350 degrees F(180 C) for 22-25 minutes. Check with a toothpick in the center.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the baking sheet, and let it cool completely, then using a very sharp or serrated knife, slice the oval into 1/2 inch thick slices. Spread these slices over the parchment-lined baking sheet again, flattened on the wider side of the biscotti.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the baking sheet, and let it cool completely, then using a very sharp or serrated knife, slice the oval into 1/2 inch thick slices. Spread these slices over the parchment-lined baking sheet again, flattened on the wider side of the biscotti.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 275 degrees F (135 C) for 1 hour, or until the biscotti is crisp to your preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 275 degrees F (135 C) for 1 hour, or until the biscotti is crisp to your preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool completely and then store in an airtight container and keep on the counter for up to three weeks. You can also ice these with a simple icing of sugar and non-dairy milk.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool completely and then store in an airtight container and keep on the counter for up to three weeks. You can also ice these with a simple icing of sugar and non-dairy milk.

keywords: cinnamon sugar biscotti, vegan biscotti, vegan cantuccini
